                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In the 1870s, Captain Nathan Algren, a cynical veteran of the American Civil war 
who will work for anyone, is hired by Americans who want lucrative contracts 
with the Emperor of Japan to train the peasant conscripts for the first standing 
imperial army in modern warfare using firearms. The imperial Omura cabinet&#039;s 
first priority is to repress a rebellion of traditionalist Samurai -hereditary 
warriors- who remain devoted to the sacred dynasty but reject the Westernizing 
policy and even refuse firearms. Yet when his ill-prepared superior force sets 
out too soon, their panic allows the sword-wielding samurai to crush them. Badly 
wounded Algren&#039;s courageous stand makes the samurai leader Katsumoto spare his 
life; once nursed to health he learns to know and respect the old Japanese way, 
and participates as advisor in Katsumoto&#039;s failed attempt to save the Bushido 
tradition, but Omura gets repressive laws enacted- he must now choose to honor 
his loyalty to one of the embittered sides when the conflict returns to the 
battlefield...

Director: Edward Zwick

Writer  : John Logan

Cast:

Ken Watanabe ...  Katsumoto 
Tom Cruise ...  Nathan Algren 
William Atherton ...  Winchester Rep 
Chad Lindberg ...  Winchester Rep Assistant 
Ray Godshall Sr. ...  Convention Hall Attendee 
Billy Connolly ...  Zebulon Gant 
Tony Goldwyn ...  Colonel Bagley 
Masato Harada ...  Omura 
Masashi Odate ...  Omura&#039;s Companion 
John Koyama ...  Omura&#039;s Bodyguard 
Timothy Spall ...  Simon Graham 
Shichinosuke Nakamura ...  Emperor Meiji 
Togo Igawa ...  General Hasegawa 
Satoshi Nikaido ...  N.C.O. 
Shintaro Wada ...  Young Recruit 

Enjoy the movie.
